title: Creep Score (cs)
body:
Whats a good cs score by 10 and 20 minutes in.
Im usually at around 60-75 by 10
and 140-160 around 20 is that any good?
I usually lead in cs in most of my games, im bronze 3 atm

replies.body:
> [{quoted}](name=XxdatpoisenxX,realm=OCE,application-id=FjGAIbRv,discussion-id=duR8YZ1E,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-12-24T09:36:00.686+0000)
>
> Whats a good cs score

It's a score that lets you be ahead of your lane opponent in terms of items throughout the game.
Thats pretty decent cs. I would expect to get myself 180 MIN by 20. My best cs score at 20 was 275 with Vlad lel
Thast's what I generally aim for, but in jungle I give myself leeway for ganking by setting the bar at 60 by 10 min, then add 75 for each 10 min afterwards (135 at 20 min, 210 at 30, etc.)
i usually get ahead in kills early, but dont usually have as much cs as the other lanes, but neither does my opponent (im talking about when i play mid and top)

I personally add a 0 to the time, and thats how much CS i **aim** for.

100 by 10
200 by 20
250 by 25 
etc etc

note that is my goal, not the baseline for what i can realistically expect to achieve.

the highest CS i have ever had was 698 with Taliyah at around an hour long game.

The max CS you can have at 10 minutes is ~115, and if you are getting anywhere from 70+ at this mark you are doing decently (this is 60.8%). Anything below this (regardless of lane events like ganks), you should probably practice on becoming consistent. 

By 20 minutes ~234 is the max CS. Similarly to above, you should be aiming for at least 60% (140), or maybe a little bit higher as it becomes easier to farm when you have items behind you. 

Follow these basic numbers, and it's one of the things that is good to be able to pull of consistently to get out of bronze.

Like Cakemeisting mentioned, the best score you can actually have is one that puts you at a CS advantage above your opponent. You will always have the upper hand in items, making it easier for you to trade in lane as well as snowball (which really demoralises enemy players). There are a number of smaller skills that you can practice that will aid in this. 

* Learn how to [trade successfully and to deny minions](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iko2tqmDpJQ&list=PL9RdXhXESRJzgY_SwHB8T-cZxXljWhQvz) (watch all vids in the series)
* Generally keep up with the [CS training](http://imgur.com/orWUCKH) (even just as a 5 minute warmup, before you play a game and track your progress)
* Learning wave manipulations so you can know when to push and when to freeze (and how to as well), and what will screw your enemy over the most.  (covered in the first link)
The minimum requirement per 10 minutes for each lane differs. Which lanes are you acheiving this score in?

Since I am not a good player myself so I place the benchmark really low.

Generally I believe that _at the very least_, 100 cs before 30 min mark (supports exempted). But some people seem to aim that "100 cs per 10 min" rule. But hey, up to you I suppose.

You want to maximise your chances of winning, and keeping your cs high is definitely one sure way to approach it, but there is no rule for what cs you should have at a certain point of the game as there are too many variables in play. So really just take a rough range in which you're comfortable with and push yourself to get some cs from time to time, as long as your cs is more than your opponent (or if you have kills to make up for it), it's good cs I say.

I won't worry too much about the number itself.
